author: m.kalinin
content: The problem with option 2 is that CL should communicate that value for each payload. This isn't what each CL client does today. During sync some CLs are running block_hash validation by themselves and call `newPayload`  infrequently to guide EL's sync. So, with option 2 it's not guaranteed that each block will have the max value stored alongside to it, and when the gap is around fork boundary it becomes tricky to decide which max value to use for RPC calls

author: tersec
content: This would be a notable pessimization for Nimbus (and other CLs which do this). And, yes, the ELs could figure out this information, but if they can do that, they don't need it from the CLs at all

author: jgm
content: I put in https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/608 which adds the target gas limit to `engine_forkChoiceUpdated`.  If the CL is going to pass the EL the target/max blob counts then it may make sense to add it to this PR, rather than have yet another version of `engine_forkChoiceUpdated` in the near future.
